content:
The H2BPDC-MIMS ligand was synthesized following the procedure as that in our previous work (Scheme S1), and the white powder-like product was given with a high yield of 95% (see the Supporting Information).

Synthesis of <bold>UiO-67</bold> and <bold>UiO-67-MIMS</bold>

UiO-67 and UiO-67-MIMS were obtained following the same procedure as that for the UiO family reported using 4,4′-biphenyl-dicarboxylate acid (H2BPDC) and H2BPDC-MIMS, respectively. Based on the formula Zr6O4(OH)4(BPDC)6 of UiO-67, the corresponding composites of UiO-67-MIMS may be viewed as Zr6O4(OH)4(BPDC-MIMS)6. For the synthesis of UiO-67-MIMS, in a 20 mL Teflon-lined autoclave, ZrCl4 (56 mg, 0.27 mmol) and 45 equiv of the modulator acetic acid (0.695 mL) were mixed and dissolved in 10 mL of DMF under ultrasonication for about 5 min. The linker H2BPDC-MIMS (120 mg, 0.27 mmol) was then added to the clear solution and dissolved by ultrasonication for another 5 min. Then, the Teflon-lined autoclave was kept in an oven at 120 °C for 24 h under static conditions. After cooling down to room temperature, the precipitate was isolated by centrifugation. The resulting solids were washed and refluxed with methanol for 24 h to remove the unreacted linker and metal salts and then subjected to further drying at 120 °C under vacuum for 24 h. The desolvated/activated sample was kept inside a glove box for further use.
clean_text:
Syntheses

Synthesis of H2BPDC-MIMS

The H2BPDC-MIMS ligand was synthesized following the procedure as that in our previous work (Scheme S1), and the white powder-like product was given with a high yield of 95% (see the Supporting Information).

Synthesis of UiO-67 and UiO-67-MIMS 

 UiO-67 and UiO-67-MIMS were obtained following the same procedure as that for the UiO family reported using 4,4'-biphenyl-dicarboxylate acid (H2BPDC) and H2BPDC-MIMS, respectively. Based on the formula Zr6O4(OH)4(BPDC)6 of UiO-67, the corresponding composites of UiO-67-MIMS may be viewed as Zr6O4(OH)4(BPDC-MIMS)6. For the synthesis of UiO-67-MIMS, in a 20 mL Teflon-lined autoclave, ZrCl4 (56 mg, 0.27 mmol) and 45 equiv of the modulator acetic acid (0.695 mL) were mixed and dissolved in 10 mL of DMF under ultrasonication for about 5 min. The linker H2BPDC-MIMS (120 mg, 0.27 mmol) was then added to the clear solution and dissolved by ultrasonication for another 5 min. Then, the Teflon-lined autoclave was kept in an oven at 120 °C for 24 h under static conditions. After cooling down to room temperature, the precipitate was isolated by centrifugation. The resulting solids were washed and refluxed with methanol for 24 h to remove the unreacted linker and metal salts and then subjected to further drying at 120 °C under vacuum for 24 h. The desolvated/activated sample was kept inside a glove box for further use.
